main event: A pilot observed a perfectly round, jet-sized object with a long white trail of flame in the sky over Goodland, Kansas.
interesting points: The object was moving in a straight line and appeared to be descending.
The object was observed for about 15 seconds and was traveling at an extremely high speed, estimated to be around 3,500 miles per hour.
The report indicates that the sighting was likely caused by a meteor.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were clear with good visibility.
The sighting was reported by a pilot, Lt. A.G. Alexander, who was an instructor pilot at Naval Air Station Hutchinson, Kansas.
sighted object: A perfectly round object the size of a jet with a long white trail of flame
witnesses: Lt. A.G. Alexander, an instructor pilot at Naval Air Station Hutchinson, Kansas
